Patient 1: A 68-year-old male with a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and type 2 diabetes. He is currently taking lisinopril, atorvastatin, and metformin. His family history includes cardiovascular disease, with his father having had a myocardial infarction at age 55. He has no known drug allergies. In the past, his metformin dose was adjusted due to gastrointestinal side effects.
